sorry about that: leaf-green: I currently have WinXP and xubuntu dual booting using GRUB. Will simply deleting the xubuntu partition using the live CD cause WinXP to boot on default?
Probably not.  (It might though, under certain configurations, you likely aren't configured that way though))

You need to replace the windows bootloader (ideally).  You should ask in ##windows if there's any easy way to do that.  If there isn't, there's some more options we have (we can always use GRUB by itself, without a full linux install, that just requires some manual things)
